TopicTitle: Escape the Girder Tree! - (Challenge... Sort of)

Articles.Content:
Hello

This Post is thread sorta belongs in the challenge section, but I put it here because Its almost impossible to score this challenge and its based mainly around a craft.

But anyway, while trying to think up interesting new ways to play KSP, I thought perhaps I could make some kind of assault/parkour course for kerbals to navigate. It was suprisingly easy to come up with some tricky but possible obstacles for kerbals to climb over, and although this course does have some design flaws, it is actually quite a fun little minigame. Here are a few screenshots of the course:

[spoiler= I wish spoilers still worked ]

"The Girder Tree"The goal is to use the capsule at the top to escape

KSP equivalent of the Total Wipeout Red Balls

Tomfred on the hurdles!

Important stuff Before Downloading:

-You Must Press 1 before trying to EVA a Kerbal. This will extend all ladders and allow your kerbals to get out.

-Quicksave as much as possible, This is because kerbals can go into a t-pose and fall over, not allowing you to get back up (This can happen a lot). If this happens, try using your RCS pack. Otherwise reload with F9

Quicksave, because when this happens, you may need to reload

-The course runs fine on my PC, I have No Idea whether it will on anybody else's. Sorry if it runs slow. If it does, try removing the red launch clamps

-When you reach the capsule at the top, you need to create a new stage and put the 2 radial engines into it in order to start them!

-If you get stuck at a jumpy bit, try using your EVA pack to get some extra height by thrusting upwards whilst jumping

-This was a bit of an experiment. There may be many problems. It may also turn out to be a total disaster. If so, I apologize for polluting the forum

So, download and have fun. Think you got a good time? Post it below (although there will be no judging due to lack of evidence). How about trying to make your own kerbal course for other players to try? Why not post it below?

Thanks, Zpox357

+ If there is a problem, I may not be able to respond immediately. I hope I can deal with anything ASAP
